comments.text: After asking around for a while a czech driver came up to us and offered us a ride to Štrba, right before Poprad.
Not bus but gas comment up /
Great spot, worked there on the bus station. Dont say to my boss but at the back of the gas station outside is valve where you can fill your bottle with clean water. :)
Very good place in direction to Martin or Poprad but you have to stand much further before the road turns to a gas station because cars are driving really fast and they need a lot of space to stop.

rather far than never
successfully to liptovský mikuláš
I just started and car stoped next to me. Czech family went home from vacation. There was one place for me in the car.

I'm surprised nobody has marked this spot. Anyway, I was going from Budapest to Brno, followed Hitchwiki, and tried to not get into the city. I asked my driver to stop at a gas station before Bratislava, and this was the first after the border (and it seems, if your driver is going to Bratislava, there is no other gas station.

Most drivers here don't go to CZ, but after 30 mins of asking a truck driver gave me a ride to Brno. It's a very good spot for Wien, Germany and East Slovakia (Nitra), bu
Waited with Bratislava sign, got ride to Slovnaft highway gas station near Trencin.
Best way to Bratislava and whole A1,.. also for Brno,Ostrava, or ewen Prague
We had a sign Banska Bystrica but our driver took us straight to Bratislava
Nice spot to Banska Bistrica, Zvolen and towards to Hungary. Bus stop with sliproad and shelter, drivers can see you from far. Lot of cars goes to Banska Bistrica.
Excellent spot. Waited here several times, there is enough traffic, but many cars go just a few villages further.
Second car took me to Košice
You can stop car which leaving, or ask people. Third person took me to Kosice
Immediately got picked up to Podolínec
Great spot at the bus stop, turned down two rides before getting one directly to Poprad, all of that in ten minutes.
Not a bad place, easy to catch traffic going south
Perfect spot for a ride to Šahy, Budapest. Just ask people at the gas station.
Wanted to go to Bratislava. I got dropped off at some gas station on the highway.
Good spot to Bratislava
Sign saying BB (Banská Bystrica), got a ride to Zvolen
Third car stopped and took me straight to Ružomberok. I walked onto the station as the door always open
Nice bus stop, got a ride straight to Prešov
Best spot on Bardejov to get a ride south, there is a bus bay for cars to pull over. We got a ride near Prešov pretty quick.
A lot of car.
Very good spot. Most drivers go to Budapest
Great for both directions Bratislava (west) and Žilina (north east). Cars see you and have space to stop at
Great spot for reaching Poland. I only got a ride to the border but to Krakow should be very possible.
Doesn’t even feel like a good place but people are just that nice, 2 minutes for a ride straight to Poprad
With a sign saying SL for Stará Ľubovňa, not much traffic but shouldn’t take too long either
We asked for cardboard at the gas station to make Brno sign. When we exited the gas station we instantly got offered ride to Brno.
We waited at bus stop with Drietoma sign. From Drietoma we hitchhiked to Brno easly.
Great spot on the bus stop. Enough place for truck to stop. Perfect place to go north to Banska Bystrica or Poland.
First guy I asked took me to Bratislava
Lots of space, quickly got a ride to Stará Ľubovňa that left me right in front of the castle
There’s some space in front of the factory for cars to pull over. Sign said SL (Stará Ľubovňa), got off in Podolínec
There’s some kind of castle in front of which cars can stop safely, immediately got picked up to Kežmarok
Quick ride to Poprad
Immediate ride to Liptovský Mikuláš
Sign saying LM for Liptovský Mikuláš, got a ride to Liptovský Hrádok
With a sign saying BB for Banská Bystrica I got a ride that ended up taking me all the way to Ružomberok.

Great spot, cars aren’t going too fast, there’s space to stop because that’s also the entry to some industrial place. Got offered a ride by motorcycles but didn’t have a helmet, got another one quickly to Banská Štiavnica
Lots of space to stop, but cars might be coming fast.
I was going geocaching in the forest, so I wanted to get a ride up there. A car stopped very quickly and took me there.
good spot, alot of cars but only 70km/h
i got a ride very quick! slow road with many cars
Highway is closed, all cars needed to pass here +were slow, not much space but good spot
good spot might take. while bc of traffic being light
Stop sign- easy to ask
Decent traffic and having a sign PL will get you across the border without a problem
raised a thumb and immediately 2 cars stopped at once.
I’ve hitchhiked to Krakow and I got a direct ride from a Polish driver. It was super easy 😁
There are two roads joining so you have to stand in such a place that allows you catching all the cars. Nice place like most bus stops on such roads
Not much cars but easy for catching a ride, very much place to stop 🤟👍
it was a nice summer walk
I was waiting at the begining of the gas station with Poland sign. Not much traffic but every car are going towards Poland. (1 girl). Nice views tho :)

i was heading towards High Tatras for a hike. walked for like 10 minutes from train station towards Tatras through Skorupovo with my thumb out and got a ride almost under first mountain. you will definitely hitch a ride while walking on the side of the road
Pretty good spot, cars see you for quite some time for slow speed area, as well as a wide bus stop, got a car towards Parnica direction within couple minutes
Good, visible spot towards Lucenec and Zvolen. Not on the Shell gas station, but next to it there is a big curb, great spot for cars to spot.

Stood here at the exit of the Slovnaft gas station. Cars go a bit fast, but there is a good place to stop. Got to rimavska sobota. This is a better spot to go west in roznava, better than the shell gas station northeast.
I chose this spot to go west (Zvolen, Bratislava) from Košice and it seemed the best to me. I took a bus 52 from the city and here I waited barely 5 min on Saturday lunch. Got to Rožňava.
Amazing spot and really picturesque

Super easy spot heading west! Cars slow down as they approach the town, and it seems like many are just passing through, heading either west or south. I managed to get a ride all the way to the Czech Republic (hey, Leon 👋). A lot of cars, though!
There is a petrol station, stood in the end of it with a thumb and a sign. Caught a car in a few minutes straight to Štúrovo.
3rd car stopped. Zero english but very kind and had fun Google translate conversation. Walked along road with thumb, took me to the train station.
Just walking along the quiet road with thumb. 3rd car stopped, spoke good English and took me to Dalmeny.
I was immediately picked up by a driver going to Bratislava. Although, the border control post doesn't work anymore, cars have to slow down and drivers can easily decide whether to stop or not.
Good spot if you get dropped off in Považská Bystrica. Plenty of room for drivers to spot you and stop. It is also going right on a highway
no problem for direction east, slovaks are some of the most hh friendly people in my experience
It's not the best place, but we still managed to get a ride to bratislava with just a thumbs up
OK
Get a ride for Vienna, we talked with the first guy and he accepted
Great spot heading to Komárno, or to small villages
Good place for hitchiking, a lot of cars going down south (we were heading to Bratislava). Cars can stop at the bus stop.

Good spot for going to Budapest.
Cars can stop and the trafic is slow and good

Very busy gas station with lots of drivers going south, unfortunately many of them were family cars with no room for 2 travelers. Luckily we caught a ride to Budapest in about 30 minutes.
I suspect most people should be able to catch a ride from in within an hour by asking around, at least during day time.

good location across the street from the store.  drivers stop to go to the store and you can approach the driver and ask to go with him.  If you are going to Ukraine, I recommend waiting for a truck with Ukrainian numbers.  and then talk with the driver to get to the border;)
Plenty of spots along this road. This shopping centre is closed and has a good spot for people to pull over. Easily got a ride to Bratislava
We were asking people, got ride to Bratislava quickly
Decent spot to go to Hungary or bratislava
Good place when heading to Bratislava, you need to ask drivers but we (2 guys) got a ride in a few minutes.
There are many drivers there, and you can always ask for a ride, in our case, we got a ride to Bulgaria.
A service station, a bigger one, good for asking people for a lift.
No clue what went wrong, I had a sign saying PP for Poprad, but no one seemed interested. Eventually got a ride to Ružomberok and took the train from there because it was getting wet and dark.
Really good spot, got a ride pretty much instantly
Great spot, i catch a car after 5 minutes and took me to Poprad
Got a ride to Ruzomberok after waiting for 10 minutes, great spot.

Very good place to stop cars because cars are slow after traffic lights and they have also bus stop for "parkin´" for a while, there are a lot of cars and it is the best way from Zilina to western Slovakia ( Ruzomberok, Kosice..)
Sign saying BB for Banská Bystrica, quickly got a ride to Zvolen

Probably the best place to get out of Banksa Štiavnica. It is on a steep hill so cars see you for a long time and speed is slow and there is bus stop, but cars could not see it from going uphill. The driver was going to Zvolen, so I asked to be left out at the gas station on highway next to Budča (I was trying to get to Bratislava so I just crossed the highway)
jó
good spot, many truckers are making stops here, even at night i was hitchhiking in winter and got a ride with a trucker from Turkey

There is a parking for truck and car to buy a vignette, not a lot trafic(cuz peple buy vignette on the internet) but when you ask people it a great spot a I have a few offers tu Ruzomebrek and Bratislava, but catch striaght to Lublana

I started HH here, my destination was Szeged ( Hungary) but I had a sing ( Bratislava) but it was so Lucky that a couple took me to Budapest!!! Very lucky! I think this spot is good and bad ! Everything depends about the traffic you have here ! Many trucks! But they don't speak English sometimes and hard to explain them where and WHY you are doing Autostop!

At first we thought it must be a bad spot because the of the second traffic line, because of which cars couldn't stop, but after like half an hour a polish truck stopped. We asked the driver if hes going to Banska bystrica, and we found out he was heading to Budapest! Such a nice guy, nice spot 👌  but there's a lot of buses stopping there so be careful
Gave up after an hour standing in the rain with a sign to Banska Bystrica. I know I am weak, but I just didnt want to be in the rain and sign was starting to get very wet
Two people, very short waiting time to Banska Bystrica.
4 couples to Donovaly, every got a ride within 5 mintues
I tried more plases for direction to Banska Bystica or Zvolen. Statisticaly this is the best.
Vary good spot, insane traffic.
A local took me here and said that it’s a great spot. A Polish truck stopped and gave me a ride to the Romanian border.
Within 30 minutes we hitchhiked a man who drove us straight to Budapest. Many cars are heading this way towards Hungary. Heavy traffic.
We got a ride from 2 Slovaks to Miškolc quickly. It's better spot than Barca in Košice

You can start hitchhike there or walk bit out from village. You can come here from the city by bus nr. 12
Almost all cars drive to direction to Hungary. It´s very easy there.
Got picked up by some Poles who misunderstood my sign saying KK (Kežmarok)

Very busy fuel station with friendly people, we stood by the exit with a Košice sign for quite long but no one picked us up, when we started to ask around it just took 5 people to get a ride straight there
very good spot!
Doesn't feel so good as a spot but works surprisingly well
I tried two times here and it worked well
Wasn’t great for me, had a sign saying HU and no one seemed really interested. Only got a ride to Krupina after a hour waiting
Great spot, lots of trucks, after 10 minutes of waving our thumbs, we were already in the truck straight to Budapest

Good spot if u go south in direction of Budapest. There is a lot of space and  lots of trucks use this road to go from Poland to Hungary. Got lift with a Turkish truck driver while I was going to this bus stop.
Great spot to Poprad, got picked by a young family. The girl had a labubu, the guy blasted Goral music while smoking windows closed and they also had a child behind
really good spot. Behind the traffic light so cars go slowly and planty space to stop. (1 girl)
just behind the lights is something like a restplace. (direction žilina)
Hard shoulder on road 18/D1 in direction Poprad.
Got a ride to Žilina in no time
With a sign saying TR (Turčianske Teplice), almost immediately got taken to Martin.
the spot might not look very good, but it worked for me quite fine, and there's not a better spot in the town, because the road is too near the river.
A good spot right across the street from Tesco supermarket. Stand between the bus stop and pedestrian crossing, there´s enough space for cars to pull over
good for anything
Okey spot to go in direction of Ruzomberok. Cars don't go fast and have a little space to stop. I was hh with "BB" (Banska Bystrica) sign.
Hitching while hiking.
Second car took me to Prešov
A bit tricky, as cars come up fast and it can be hard for them to stop on the incline. Still, we lucked out.
You’re very visible and lots of space to pull over, very easy to get to Poprad
bus stop easy to hh
Lots of space to pull over at the bus stop. Good spot to catch the traffic going towards the highway in various directions.
to rozemberg in 5 min
I didn’t autostop, I approached the drivers and asked them to cross the border with them, they quickly agreed)
Previous driver dropped us off and first people we asked took us to Nowy Targ

Ok spot I was just standing in front of the gas station, sometimes asked and two times they asked me where I want to go somewhere. 

Both highways Are possible to go 😊

Great spot, depends where you're going to. Extremely easy to get to Bratislava, also Vienna. But on Monday morning there were literally no cars going to Brno, Czechia. Only handful of truck drivers in the early morning the next day. During the weekend I would guess its better for Czechia.
I asked drivers with sign TN and I got ride to the TN (Trencin) immediately.
Petrol station Zelenec, towards Trencin/Zilina. Possible to get a ride straight into Poland if you're lucky!

Doesn't seem to have a lot of traffic going out of the city. Our driver had to go in Zvolen but dropped us all the way in Divin, 40km away. 
Might make more sense to find a placce a bit more on the outskirts of the city.
3 people.  Waited 3 minutes before we got a ride.  The ride took us 40 mins down 50 going east.
Great spot to Bardejov
Got a ride only 15 km.
petrol station direction Vranov/PL.
With a sign saying BS (Banská Štiavnica), got a ride to Zvolen
Good spot if u go in direction of Zvolen or Nitra. There is a OMV petrol station and McD. Got a ride with "ZV" sign in no time :)

Got a lift to Zvolen. I would say a pretty nice spot. You can ask the drivers in gas station or just wait at the exit. There should be not only local traffic because it is also a exit from the town to highway

bad than I expect.
planned to go to Rumania.
moved here from bratislava. took bus to nearest spot eat from here and walked 30mns was good hiking but you have to break into highway side bush 300m.
one man took just crossed border to hungary than we got on in 10mns.
Not easy to get there, but then quick,  in few minutes when we were sitting there and having snack someone came and ask if we want to take and took us straight to Budapest.
Decent spot, but only truck drivers stop herę
Two personal, tir driver stopped

Perfect spot to go to Rozemberok
Plenty of space for cars to stop

2 boys to Ruzomberok ~10min. We was dropped in the centrum and to get out the city was a big walk so we wasted a lot of time. Ask the driver to drop off before the city or else you must walk 30min to reach the end this city! Probably before the city are better places.

To Ruzomberok. Quite good spot with bus station where cars can stop. Traffic must slow down because there is a pedestrian crossing after the bus stop. Maybe it is better to walk 400m forward, there is a gas station. You can ask drivers personally.
Just a very very good spot for poland generally
Good for the direction of Cadca and for the czech republic
Don't stand here, go to the bus station couple of meters north. From there I hitchhiked several times to Kremnica, always very short waiting times
Kremnica & Martin directon a bit problematic spot, because of less space. lower traffic.
To kremnica
Straight to Rozomberok
The petrol station. Good place to Ružomberok.
Enough space. Gas station near. Direction south. We waited for 20'
Was quite fast to get to Levice

bus station is perfect. Levice wothin 25 minutes (tried several times), Banska Stiavnica is bad choice because through Zarnovica is better. Velky Krtis after the new bypass is worse (better to walk 25 minutes to bypass)
the best spot to Levice, there is a petrol station nearby but it is dead, so I tried this bus station, I didnt have to wait more than 10 min
no one wanted to take us towards Poland, when we switched sign to "Žilina" we got a ride in 30 minutes
Got ride to Zilina
Wanted to go to Zilina but the 3rd person I asked was going around Trencin so they dropped me off at OMV gas station at D1 in Trencin. From there I got ride to Zilina in less then 5 minutes
We waited only 1 minute to take a drive to Zilina.
Got a truck to Žilina in 30min.
Asking around with Zilina sign, 2 people in 5 minutes wanted to give me ride. I went to Lietavska Lucka so I picked the guy which wanted to drop me off there.

The spot is a gas station on the highway D1 on direction north to Žilina. Maybe the last big gas station before Žilina. Use it si useful also to switch the car if it is not going to Žilina directly. 

You can walk there from Trenčín. It is quite far but a far the best place to get to Žilina from Trenčín. 

You have to walk a little bit, count with 40 minutes atleast,. From center or stations you have to go through the train bridge (pavement included) to the opposite bank of river Váh (Trenčín ha
Good spot. Make sure your sign is big enough

This is a great place to hitch, primarily becase of the signalized intersection facing you, thus the drivers have good deal of time to mediate upon the idea that taking a hitchhiker might be an interesting idea.
There was 2 of us, girl and boy. Good spot. Lots of cars and place for tham to stop. We had a big sign.
More locals drivers there since there is a highway. But still possible to get in every main direction in Slovakia.

It used to be a very good place, nowadays it's little bit worse, but lot of cars are driving that road, also lot of space for a car to stop and it's before the highway to the north of Slovakia (there also use to be lot of hitchhikers).

We were 2 guys, the spot positionally not ideal, but cars can still stop there and we managed to get directly to Wien. I think best spot from Bratislava to Wien or at least some gas station on the highway.
didn't end up getting a ride but lots of traffic, seems quite fast and there's not a rlly good spot to pull over either

Realy good Spot to Catch a Ride to Vienna 
IT took us about 30min with sign but i think IT also will Work with thoumb.
Waited 30 minutes until I got a ride to Vienna, lots of traffic and enough space to stop, but the cars are already pretty fast

Don't stand to close to the motorway entry, since drivers have to pay attention to the traffic. I stood at the gateway in front of the pedestrian bridge with a "Wien" sign. There is also a bus lane, so cars have enough tim and space to pull over. I was waiting less than 10 minutes on a monday morning.
Probably the best spot going south from Martin, got a ride to Turčianske Teplice
In  my opinion it's the only place to get out of Martin in direction of TR, ZH, Kremnica, Prievidza. Hitchhiking elsewhere on the bypass was nearly senseless for me.
Good spot for Hungary, just pay more attention for hungarian licence plates

Big bus (nr.12, 24, 52, 52 L, 54) and tram (nr.3, 4, 9, 7, R2, R8) stops (different places of stops, some of them you have just cross through the traffic lights to get this spot) if you go from the city direction to Hungary.  Enough space to stop cars. We waited only 5 minutes.
iom post iom ni daŭre moviĝis
Good spot, on the way out of city, to Spišska bela.
Spot is good overall some place to stop but nor much traffic at all we got so lucky bcs someone stopped and took us to the exact place we were going
good spot on onramp light traffic tho

Most people only go to Žiar nad Hronom, my tip would be to accept the ride and go to a bus stop before the highway. I tried for 6o minutes to get a direct ride to Nitra from here without a luck.

A good option is to signal with a thumb or a sign at the exit of the gas station, there is a place for cars to stop. And if you see the car going to the gas station, moving there to ask them.
Slovnaft gas station - Only for rides south to Žiar nad Hronom and further, since the gas station is not accessible on the way north.

Actually it turns out, that the newly built highway rest area "Pohranice" right before Nitra is much more popular now.

So if you are going towards Bratislava, and your driver goes just to Nitra, it is better to get out not here but on "Slovaft Pohranice" rest area.

Big highway rest area.

Good transit spot, you can get to Bratislava, Nitra, even south to Nove Zamky
Be patient and do not give up. Got my ride to Humenne

I got dropped off here on my way to Poland. It was definitely not my preferred spot to hitchhike but after making a big sign and standing a few meters infront of the busstop a car took me straight to Poland. The cars do drive very fast there because its downhill, but there is a traffic light which sometimes slows them down.
First person I asked at the gas station took me to Presov. He was going to Bratislava.
local took us to the border because he was bored xd
bus picked us up for free
not many cars, but they are going to small cities with good spots

The service station was reasonably busy at 10am on a Thursday. I stood at the exit. Was trying to go to Warsaw from Kosice. Not sure if the highway route is better than taking the regional roads through Lublin but I decided to see. Quite quickly found a ride to Ruzomberok and onto the E77 into Poland.
Ĉado kaj mi, el la teamo "La Amerikaj Knaboj" en "Tramprennen", faris ĝin ĝis la limo.
Doesn’t feel as great as the bus stop but at least all the traffic is going somewhere. Got a ride to the border in 10 minutes
Hitching while walking
Got a ride to Liptovský Hrádok with a sign saying Hrádok
Cars are going fast but at least there’s space to stop. I got picked up by a car entering the highway from Turčianske Teplice
Just walking down the road and a lady took me, you can probably ask cars leaving Vlkolínec directly
Good stop for Levoča, probably usable for everything to the east that isn’t on the highway.
Didn't seem to bad for further distances too, we just wanted to get into Košice which was v easy
People going to the next villages but one the way towards Budapest
Kinda good spot for bratislava. There is a bus stop. Actually bus stopped for us and took us for free.
Many cars going, good place

Asked first person on the gas station and got a ride to Ružomberok. 
Hard to reach spot. You have to walk through the village, under the bridge to the other side of the road and than cross it to gas station. Medium traffic.

We were hitchhiking through Slovakia and got a rider to Bardejov. Not a lot of traffic, a lot of Polish people and there is a bus bay for cars to pull over. Not the best spot, but good enough to get to a bigger city.

Not a lot of traffic towards north, so I just walked along the road, touristic area, got a ride with 20 minutes, but no nice shoulder for cars anywhere (there were roadworks in Parnica so I couldnt really hitchhike there) still pretty nice road
Towards Dolny Kubin, medium traffic, lots of locals, anywhere in this village seems okayish, but not the best place for cars to stop, still got a ride within 20 minutes
Stood with a thumb, but it might be better with a sign, since the drivers can go on the highway in 2 ways.
New big highway rest area.

It seems like the only spot in Liptovský Mikuláš where you can comfortably hitch a ride to the highway. Most of the traffic is local, but you can flag down out-of-town cars leaving McDonald's or the nearby gas station. I wrote a sign for Žilina, which turned out to be a mistake. Tip: Use a sign for Ružomberok—it's a major hub with roads branching west and south across the country.
Not too much traffic, but got a ride in just two minutes to Filakovo. The people here often speak both Hungarian and Slovak Language.
Not too much traffic, but I got a ride to Lučenec just in 10 minutes

There is a small parkingspace there.
One local picked us - a couple - up and brought us to the next campingground
On the road in front of a petrol station before a curve. Good visibility, drivers can easily stop. Got a ride quickly to Kosice.
Not much traffic, only locals, middle of nowhere xd
a good place for hitchhiking, behind the gas station, in a place where the curb widens.  Twice I caught the car, everything was fine

Very good spot as its on the main road, cars drive fast but you can push a button to turn the traffic light red so everyone stops and plenty of space to pull over as there is a bus stop. I gave 4 starts as Slovakia sucks for HH and  even a super nice spot like this one I had to wait 70min. Lot of Hungarian cars
I was sitting on the metal railing. I made pretty big WIEN sign because cars are going fast here.
Got a ride to Vienna airport almost instantly. Maybe it's a good idea to stand on/behind the bus stops so the cars stopping won't block the bus lane.
A lot od cars going fast, thanks to the bus line there is a place to stop a car and cars can see you from a longer distance.
Fav spot to Vienna
Easiest spot for Vienna
Great towards Austria, shit towards Hungary
Got ride straight to Romania after standing there with i sign saying HU/ROM. It wasn't exactly busy here tho, we were lucky.
I had sign with direction Budapest ( wanted to go to Romania ) After 5 minutes stopped the romanian car and took me almost 600km to Romania.
we were hitchhiking on wednesday afternoon, wanted to go to Budapest, but everyone was going to Vienna. Luckily some guy was going to Level, so we took it
Good spot for Vienna a lot drivers stoped and ask us to pick up,but we traveled to budapest where also we got pick up
I think I got lucky, mechanic took me more North, the gas station was not that busy as I though
Was hitchiking rather late to Bratislava not best for long rides, still cached a ride, there is shadow on the bus stop and nearby gas station is plus too
Bus stop is a very good place to hitch-hike to Bratislava or Brno direction but according to my experiences it depends on time and weather
We were trying to get to Krakow, instead we got a ride to Check-Polish boarder. Waited about an hour.
to direction to BA Czech Republic.It's a gas station.
Only to tvardosin not much trafic but place look very good to hitchhiking

I think I just had bad luck on that day but I was rottening here for nearly 4 damned hours... Lots of Krakow cars and some local slovakian cars, but did not want to stop. And there was an extreme thunderbolt and haild for 1 hours, crazy. After that I caught a Hungarian car (I am Hungarian as well) with a flag... That was the moment of saving my life! :D
Drivers in direction Slovakia often have to stop to buy the "sticker" for Slovakian highways. I got a lift further in Slovakia quite easily.
Not only to Cracow, but to Ruzemberok, Banska Bystrica or even Bratislava. There are always some trucks, and if you ask drivers, they will give you a lift easily.
Direction to Krakow.
Not a dangerous spot at all like thr comment below says. You have a good and safe plaxe to stand. Cars go a bit fast but pretty easy to thumb to at least Presov if not further.
This spot Is really dangerous. I dont racomand it
I caught the car to Poland in 5min, here.

The best place in direction to Presov. Near the bus stop Moňok (Monok) of line 33 (public transport system).  

The last meters of the speed maximum limit in the town. Concentration of all cars going out freom Kosice through this place.
Bona poento, ni estis du, ĉiu provante en vojo, kun ŝildo al la sekva urbo.
cars can stop here near the cementery, i was here at monday evening (cca 17:00), most cars in my direction (banska bystrica) from centre, not from bratislava direction
There it no so much place, for car.
30 minutes to Bratislava
There was not a lot of traffic. I was standing with a sign to Bratislava at the exit. But maybe it was better to ask around the gas station. But after an hour got picked to Bratislava
During a summer - no problems there. Enough drivers, they can take you at least a bit nearer to Bratislava. We were a couple and got a ride to Nitra.
Nice spot for hitchhiking to Bratislava.
Got taken across the border very quickly

Was very shitty for us, quick cars, three times shady people stopped that we didn't want to go with, but it was also insanely hot and there was only shade from a traffic sign. Got a very short ride behind the Hungarian border after a while but then we took the train (it's cheap)
ideal spot, went straight to debrecen

We have waited at VSS crossroad (VSS križovatka) - 1 km to the city center on the same street for almost 2 and a half hours. Then we change to this spot and instantly (in less than half a minute) one Polish trucker stopped and gave us a ride.

We were waiting at VSS crossing (VSS križovatka) (about 1 km closer to city center) for about 2 hours with no luck. After getting to this place we got a ride instantly. Friendly polish truck driver took us near Miskolc.
Ride to Dolny Kubin, a lo of locals I want to go Bratislava
We 2 boys to Ruzomberok ~25min.
A bus stop in direction to Ružomberok
long distance
Trying to go to Hungary. After 87minutes we walked further down the road.
Not the best spot but it works. Sign Brno. Russian truck driver picked me up.

On the way to Brno with a sign with Czech flag🇨🇿.. in the hour i counted 30 cars with Czech license plate.. one took me. I almost gave.. but I don't think there's a better spot from Bratislava to Brno or Czechia in general
Lunchtime on a busy Sunday after holidays. Not many cars stopping, but we were lucky and almost immediately got a ride with a guy to Prague. Definitely ask people directly.
real shit, empty gas station around noon of monday. i was lucky, a truck driver offered me a lift after 30 min to CZ

This place (even if it's a bloody petrol station) is one of the WORST places I ever hitchhiked in Europe... Stood here for long-long hours... Jesus, seriously, this place is like... fuck off. :D 1 car by 5 minutes.  Rather better to go to the roundabout 3-4 km North, there is a road which lead right onto the D2 motorway direction CZ. Anyways, good luck!
We (2guys) waited 45min to get a direct ride to brno. make sure that the other lanes can see your sign, as not many cars are using the gas station :)
We were waiting there for more than 5 hours to get to Prague, but it was Sunday in the middle of winter.
Not as bad as expected, not much space but cars aren’t going that fast and there’s some parking space

To Sachy and Hungary. Not the best place at all, cars cannot stop very well but no good places nearby. Bus stop with short sliproad and shelter. Good thing is traffic must slow down because there is a pedestrian crossing.

Towards Dolny Kubin, lots of traffic, but a lot of them are locals, waited for a 70 or so minutes for a  ride, seems like bus connection isnt the best since in the end hitchhiked with local grandma whose bus didnt arrive
Wanted to get a ride to Banska-Bistrica, but the only guy who stopped was getting to Budapest directly and I took it. There are mostly locals at this spot.
The previous comment is from 2011 before the highway. No more traffic to central Slovakia and for other long distances here.

Best spot to hitchhike towards Banská Bystrica. Most of the cars are driving from Bratislava further to central Slovakia. Always takes max 15minutes to get a ride. This spot is about 30minutes of walking from center. It is possible to take a bus to nearby shopping center MAX but still you have to walk cca 10minutes.
Car are going faster than I liked, but got ride to Žilina in 30 minutes top
Really, there's no need to walk further. Use sign! I waited 20 mins to get a lift to Ružomberok.

The only spot for going both to west and east from this town.
It doesn't make sense to go further in direction of the highway, no good spots after.
it was very bad, no one got up, I was going to Ukraine.  It helped only to personally approach the stopped truck near the store and ask the driver to bring
The place is great, not many people go to UA and some of them want to get paid.
Bus stop.
Little gas station, not so many cars in it. Many of them are just local people not driving too far.
I was waiting more than 3 hours and gave up. I went sleep to the north forest. I recommend to go to other side of the Bratislava.
Waited long time, there is a hidden path along the highway to the road bridge. Good to know, if you want to buy groceries in the Kaufland. Spot is alright.
Good spot. Asked around and was able to get a ride to Budapest in about 10-15 minutes.
Couldn't get a lift towards Hungary in 2,5 hours
we had luck, just going to better stopping place on the south from Bratislava.
